Quest Hotel & Conference Center - Cebu
8.5 Excellent
Based on 8091 reviews

We were lied to by reception and the manager on duty: We arrived at Quest Hotel at 11 pm. We booked an Executive Room and the manager informed us we'll be upgraded.

I asked if the room category is in Agoda and they said it's not yet there. When we proceeded to the room, the manager and a guard escorted us. (Dodgy)! We went to a restricted floor (23rd) which had a hallway with no art, no airconditioning - generally no "hotel feel". When the manager and guard were already in the room with us, they kept saying that this is the "upgraded room". I said something was dodgy and said that this is definitely not the room and hotel I booked. Found out through quick research that we were in Grand Cenia. And, they kept this information, so they LIED. They kept saying we were upgraded! Anyway, we had to argue our way just to get the issue resolved. Restaurant and other staff were great but Almost got SCAMMED! Grand Cenia was cheaper than what I paid for!

Show more
Czarina , Philippines
Bayfront Hotel Cebu
8.4 Excellent
Based on 2112 reviews

After 10p the only food choices in the hotel is the 7-11 downstairs GF. As a business traveler, I don't like having to resort to siopao and cup of noodles when I don't want to leave the hotel to go have something to eat.

The in-room safe was dysfunctional and kept beeping the entire night. I had to call the front desk everyday for them to unlock it so that I could get my valuables out. They did not put bath rugs in the CR to step on when getting out of the shower and around the toilet. The best thing about the hotel is the shower. it is a rainfall shower head and big enough to fit 3 people if you wanted. The next big thing about the hotel is the distance from SM City Cebu but I might try Radisson next time since that hotel is even closer. This one is no longer on my pick list.

Show more
Noel , United States
Marco Polo Plaza Cebu Hotel
8.5 Excellent
Based on 3152 reviews

My boyfriend and I were supposed to go to Bohol from January 11th through the 14th. but our trip got cancelled due to typhoon warning in Bohol.

So we were scared that there would be no hotels available due to Sinulog festival this week. Surprisingly, it says that Marco Polo had rooms available. We just booked our hotel here since we would be staying from January 14th through 16th as well. So we booked a king deluxe and we got there and told us that there weren't any king beds available. So they put us in a room with separate bedrooms for 3 nights. Then I called the front desk if we can get a king bed for the two last nights of our stay there, and the lady in the front seat said yes. So we checked out to our two separated bedrooms and went downstairs. The lady told us to check in again at 2. When we got there at 2, one of the receptionist was about to put us in a double bed again, and I had to ask politely if we can have a king bed, like what we originally paid for, and instead they put us in a queen bed, which is probably cheaper than what we paid for the king deluxe. But besides that I think it was fine. But next time, if people book a king bed or a double bed or a queen bed, they should stick with what they book cuz guests might be paying more than what they are given once they arrive in the hotel.

Show more
Krista , United States
Mandarin Plaza Hotel
8.2 Excellent
Based on 6055 reviews

We booked this hotel because it is near the establishment that we wanted to check out. Upon checking in, the staff was in a hurry to check us in and when we arrived at the room, the room has two single beds.

We have requested for a large bed or at least a double bed but not two single beds. We're a couple on a vacation and did they expect us to sleep on separate beds? Haha! We called the staff but offered us an additional rate for the bed. Since we are on a budget, we decided to sleep on one single bed. It's a good thing that we're not big people or else it would have been a disastrous stay at the hotel. Food buffet was delicious by the way. But definitely, will not be coming back. :)

Show more
Celine , Philippines
Radisson Blu Cebu
8.9 Excellent
Based on 3733 reviews

Regarding the Five Star Radisson Blu Hotel in Cebu on a scale of 1 to 5 we rated it at 10! We just had our 12th beautiful experience at the Radisson Blu Hotel in Cebu, Philippines.

The staff once again are considerate beyond belief, friendly and helpful making our experience very enjoyable. The food is great, the room service from Aaron and housekeeping from Jenny. Outstanding general attention and kindness from all levels of management and staff including a very warm and extremely hospitable Dazzle, Richard , Sabrina still a trainee but beaming with a promise. and too many persons to be able to cite by name but all of them outstanding and much appreciated. The hotel operators like Farah and Adel are both very helpful and accommodating. Another, impressive memory was during our latest visit when Rose, the business executive manager when learning that I was temporarily ill send her assistant to bring me Gatorade. The staff at the swimming pool have always been extraordinary in their attention to our needs and comfort which we appreciate. We are deeply indebted for the fine service at the pool from Charisma who is always been very kind and thoughtful in making us feel at home and comfortable. The food is excellent with new creations and innovation with their NEW OUTDOOR RESTAURANT you can really dine with the StARS and have Romantic evening with candlelight to make guests love the outdoor meals served including superior and premium steaks that my wife and I dearly loved,that WE DINE 2 nights in a ROW ! Lastly, Sous chef ,Joeffrey and executive chef Roberto Kunitz are wonderful in terms of their service to customers and are much appreciated by this customer and family. A hallmark of this beautiful restaurant is there breakfast Buffet which is the most elegant and varied breakfast buffets I’ve ever tried in my worldwide travels. The food is not only delicious but is served by the staff with loving care and attention to the guests is”exceptionnel”

Show more
LEAH , Philippines
Montebello Villa Hotel
7.8 Very good
Based on 1882 reviews

Rented 4 rooms coz my baby's 1st birthday party was held there @5pm. Btw, everything's already settled day before the event.

On the day of the party, we went at around 1:30pm, hoping to be granted an early check-in because of the said event. The staffs kept on saying sorry and looked very friendly but didn't seem to do anything to help us out. What's worse, were checked in very late; 3 rooms were provided past 3pm already, 1 premier at 4:30pm. Before the last room was given, the receptionist asked if we have already paid the room coz she didn't see it on their record. Seriously? No record of any payments? Or that was just your excuse so won't feel sorry for checking us in so late? They upgraded our room-- larger but on the 3rd floor-- no elevator coz it's a garden hotel. So with all our stuff and the baby, we opted to just use the room we rented on the ground floor. In the morning, one of your personnels just entered into our room (402) without knocking. Good thing my husband saw him and asked why he was there. The guy said sorry and said no one has been occupying the room for a long time so he didn't expect somebody will occupy that day. So you can guess what was I thinking the moment he said that. Worst part, there was an unauthorized charge from our account-- after we paid all our excess charges, cleared and checked out!! The amount may not be substantial, but the fact that you debited from our account without authorization is a serious offense. Please have the decency to inform the owners and not just take something out. Contact information is provided so you can talk to validate those charges. This might be isolated incidents -- I don't know.. but we happened to be the customers who experienced these series of unfortunate events. Regarding my baby's Birthday at Cuarto Mercedes: Kudos to Sir Jun and the team. Your service is excellent and the food is superb!

Show more
Jumar , Singapore
Cebu Parklane International Hotel
8.1 Excellent
Based on 2951 reviews

I came here after two days at the Quest hotel (their pool was being renovated) and found the room here to be much nicer than Quest, though the wifi was less consistent & fast (though some reviews say otherwise - maybe just my experience).

I stayed here for three days (and barely left my room - I had food poisoning from my plane ride to Cebu City). I can't think of a nicer place to stay and get well here in the city. Pool was refreshing, I even got a whole coconut the first day. At $42/ni usd ($53 total) it was a bargain for the quality. Close to Ayala mall. Restaurant buffet was SO YUM! I stayed in the "superior" room which was absolutely BEAUTIFUL. Cherry wood cabinetry with a mirrored mini-bar. Smelled nice (as opposed to my room at Quest smelled of sour, wet swimsuit that permeated to my clothes), simple bed (double) with clean, soft sheets and pillows. Like others said, bathroom is a bit run down - sink was wobbly and the shower leaked all over the floor (there was a drain). Carpet was stained. I don't care much about those kind of things but maybe you do! Wish the pool had more access to sun (around 1p its only in a small corner of the patio, though still there) - all around wonderful stay and would come back again. Thanks for aiding in my healing, Cebu Parklane!!

Show more
Katie , United States
Best Western Plus Lex Cebu
8.4 Excellent
Based on 1176 reviews

Good location , breakfast is good. I came to Cebu for 5 days for business travel . Upon check in they will ask you to pay a deposit( which is normal) But in my 3rd day staying .

Front desk was called me that my privilege is already exceed for limit 10,000 php. So I was confused about the exceed limit. Then I went down to front desk to make it clear to me. Further to them , its a reminder for the guest if you exceed the limit 10,000 by using room service, massage , car rentals . You have to settle and pay immediately. Otherwise you will not enjoy your privilege. I got shocked and offended, coz first and foremost upon my check in. They should oriented the guest that they have a policy like this.Therefore , guest will be aware.I oftenly travel for business trip.As far as I know that all bills are settled upon check out They even charge me double for the massage service.!! This is ridiculous !!As well Front desk should double check always and oriented.I will not coming back here anymore

Show more
Annaliza , Philippines
Red Planet Cebu
8 Very good
Based on 6078 reviews

This is my own review checklist. When I move into a hotel room, I take a tissue and wipe it along an unseen top surface, such as a picture, or a door.

This test tells me if cleaning is thorough or haphazard. / • Dust test = minor fail / • Transfers = none - yellow taxi from AP costs more than 500 P / • Location = Small 7-11next door, 4-min walk to Ayala Mall, a few restuarants nearby. You can get breakfast at Jollibee or the terrace restaurants on the NE side of the mall. / • Check in/out = efficient - lobby is one floor up from ground by elevator/ • Wifi = strong and fairly consistent. They have a sign-in system that might require you sometimes to enter codes. / • Staff = young, friendly, helpful / • Lighting = abundant with extra switches next to bed / • Bathroom = Two towels changed daily, no face cloths or hand towels. Toiletries consist of a liquid soap dispenser next to sink, and a 3-in-one dispenser in shower. Shower is strong and hot. Sink has enough room for your own toiletries, has mirror and dedicated light. / • Room = ample mirrors, hair dryer, no glasses or cups, no kettle, no fridge, / • Door security = excellent keycard with auto-lock / • Bed = slightly firm but fairly comfortable / • Linens = changed daily / • In-room safe = yes / • Electrical Outlets = limited but well-placed / • Furniture = two night tables next to bed, small panel drops down as table or desk next to bed. No chair / • Storage = none, except for a small rail with a few hangers / • Phone = no / • TV = flatscreen with numerous English channels and a simple single remote control. Unfortunately, the remote has no aspect adjustment button, so on some channels people have very wide bodies and heads. / • AirCon = loud and works fine. There is also an ceiling fan / • Facilities = internet access on two workstations in lobby. These are "stand-up" stations - probably to discouage extended use. I asked the reception staff if they had city maps.

Show more
Brian , Canada
Castle Peak Hotel
7.7 Very good
Based on 2025 reviews

I was really impressed by out room and the facilities for the little money we paid. Excellent size room Grand Superior, best price! The Kitchen menu is diverse and staff can take instructions to help my special diet, namely cooking the dishes with less oil.

Staff is excellent and friendly. Everyone is serious about what they do and well trained. I will consider this my regular stop in Cebu. There is also a nice roof top deck, and a convenience store and hair salon. Everything you need. IT park and Ayala Mall or only a 15 min walk away.

Show more
Craig , Canada
Hotel Elizabeth Cebu
8.1 Excellent
Based on 1155 reviews

Price: we could not believe what we saved by staying here. A well known chain hotel nearby charges twice what we paid at the Elizabeth and, having stayed there 3 months prior, we believe the Elizabeth to be the best value.

The staff is outstanding! From greeting you every time when opening the doors for you to adding extra coffee in the room. Room features: very spacious room with additional furnishings, mini fridge for personal use, oversized bath, numerous bath amenities, full set of towels for 2, very comfortable king bed, A/C and heating system that is whisper quiet, large windows for plenty of daylight. The cleaning staff is very good at their job too. Everyone there is very pleasant and happy to serve you. They even clean and mop the brick driveway throughout the day! They will happily go to the street and hail a taxi for you or, if you prefer, they will call a private car to assist in your travels. The staff is outstanding! We used the restaurant only for the breakfast buffet which seemed acceptable to most, but I found few American dishes available on a daily basis though they did change some selections each day. I was accepting of this since they cater to many different cultures that travel to their city and it would be impossible to satisfy everyone every day. Also, it gave me the opportunity to try the local dishes. The bar has knowledgeable staff that know how to make drinks properly. The Hotel Elizabeth is also within a 2 block walking distance to the well known, super clean Ayala Mall. The mall is huge, with outdoor gardens and many restaurants to choose from. I personally give this place a 5 star rating for their overall cleanliness and willingness to make everyone happy. We liked it so much, that we cancelled another leg of our trip to go back to the Elizabeth to enjoy the last 4 days of our journey in a very relaxing environment. Trust me, this is the place to stay when visiting Cebu City. Oh, and did I say the staff is outstanding? Well, the sta

Show more
David , United States
Harolds Hotel
8.5 Excellent
Based on 1822 reviews

The entourage for my friend's wedding stayed here for the wedding prep (i.e. make up, dressing up). I was staying with my husband and baby in another room while the rest of my friends got the connecting rooms.

We've been asking them for a long time prior to check in to place us in one floor so it would be convenient for us to run from one room to another. But they kept saying they can't guarantee it so we understood. When we checked in, they said we'll all be on the 6th floor. But at the very last minute said that they had to move ours to 8th floor! Great. Inconvenience kicked in when I had to take 2 flights of stairs to go up and down 2 floors because their elevator works by key card and mine doesn't work for 6th floor. Mind you, I'm a breastfeeding mom and had to constantly go up to 8th floor to breastfeed my baby and then go back again to 6th to have my make-up, etc. My options were to take the stairs or use the elevator, go to ground floor and ask the bellman to punch in 6th floor. Next, we were told over the phone by one of the receptionists that if we leave trash on the place, they will charge us 1000 pesos for it. Yep, ridiculous! Isn't that what your housekeeping staff is for? I mean, do they expect their guests to do the cleaning? Lastly, when we checked out the room where my family stayed in, the room checker said we took Oreo from the bar. Nuh uh, we didn't. There was no Oreo in the bar or in the fridge. All I saw when we got in the room were the cup noodles. And I'm sorry but none of us like strawberry oreo. The hotel in itself has good facilities (no swimming pool though). The place is clean but they should also invest on training their staff to be courteous, friendly, accommodating and, most importantly, rational. Your hotel experience can only be 100% satisfactory if the facility and staff are superb.

Show more
Grace , Philippines
Summit Circle Cebu
7.6 Very good
Based on 1590 reviews

We had a great stay at this hotel for 4 days. Check in is quick and easy. We booked for a Deluxe King room and it has a sofa and mini table aside from a working table and of course a large comfortable bed.

They also provide a safe for your belongings and a mini ref. You have a free water supply daily and towels are being changed daily when you request to make up your room. Supplies such as soap and shampoo are replenished as well. Only wish for the shower area to have a little more space. Buffet breakfast is great also, they have a wide selection. I only wish they also have hot chocolate available for those who doesn't want coffee and juice. Staff also greets you from time to time and they are friendly. Wifi is free, they change the password from time to time so you'll have to ask the reception about it. They allow late check out until 2pm free of charge, you just have to inform them so they can make a note about it. Beyond 2pm will have a 1800 php charge and that is good until 6pm. The place is just above Robinsons Fuente mall. We just didn't have the time to explore the facilities as we were out most of the time but overall stay is great. We hope to stay here when we visit Cebu City again.

Show more
Aileen , Philippines
Eloisa Royal Suites
8.4 Excellent
Based on 967 reviews

We returned to this small cozy hotel as we had previously enjoyed the great location near Mactan Airport, their very modern and very clean bedrooms and bathrooms.

But to our surprise the offered complimentary airport shuttle we had ordered via Agoda failed to pick us up at the airport. When phoning the hotel, the answering clerk claimed we had not booked any pick-up shuttle, which was obviously untrue. When arriving to the hotel the check-in procedure took over half an hour in spite of us not having to queue up behind anybody; one extremely patient couple queuing up behind us calmly witnessed the interminable check-in procedure by a young trainee, as it seemed; there was nobody else except her behind the reception counter. It was absolutely incomprehensible, as this was a repeat visit to Eloisa Royal Suites and the hotel already had all our personal details in their records from our previous visit with only the room number and my signature to be added. The breakfast buffet is rather small and not very attractive. Having learned from our previous experience, the next morning we went downstairs for breakfast at 6 a.m. in order to get anything at all, as on our previous visit we had arrived only at 7 a.m. to find the tiny breakfast room overcrowded with hotel guests unable to find where to sit and the overwhelmed 3 or 4 waitresses unable to cope, resulting in empty coffee pots and empty food plates which nobody refilled and nobody was available to prepare the eggs for the many guests. The 6 a.m. arrival on our latest visit solved this problem, at least for us.

Show more
Tomas , Austria
Pillows Hotel Cebu
8.1 Excellent
Based on 1207 reviews

We got the superior room, and we're pleasantly surprised that the bed is larger than the usual queen/double beds.

It actually feels like a king size. Bed and pillows are "fluffy good" as advertised. The room is spacious and clean. The staff are all friendly and quick on their feet -- always eager to help you with your needs. The hotel is just walking distance from pharmacies, a bakery, hospital, Robinsons, and the famous Larsian. My only complaint is that the bidet was leaking and the exhaust fan is really noisy but doesn't really take away the bad smell from the bathroom. And since it's not working properly, the floor is almost always wet. We didn't bother asking to have it fixed since we understand it's not really doable for a few minutes and thought it'd be a hassle since we need the room. But it's just a minor problem, and we were still able to use the bathroom. I just wish they'd fix it especially the leaking bidet that has a really strong pressure when used that the water feels like a sharp, pointed object poking at you. Other than a few bathroom facilities that need to be fixed, the room is excellent overall. Good TV channels, and working wi-fi. Highly recommended for people who work while traveling just like my boyfriend and me.

Show more
Mariel , Philippines
Cebu R Hotel - Mabolo
7.9 Very good
Based on 865 reviews

First of all.....I am not picky. This hotel is a hotel that have seen it's better days. Totally worn out.

In this case, what you pay for is NOT what you get. The rooms are small and not welcoming at all. The internet is very poor and you should be lucky if you got internet access at all. ** AGODA....Shame on you! This hotel should not be promoted on the Agoda website at all. Agoda promote this hotel as a 3 star hotel. 3 stars is a joke! I have stayed in B&B with much better service and standard for less. ** DO NOT INCLUDE BREAKFAST Do not spend the extra and include breakfast in your stay. What I loved: 1. PRICE! (I mean omg are you insane? It's like hostel/backpackers/pension house price for a hotel) 2.

Wi-Fi - if you stay in Cebu a while you'll realize that fast and reliable internet is very rare in budget hotels. (even in expensive ones) Here it was fast AND reliable. 3. Location - lots of options in the area and short uber anywhere else (or jeep or taxi) Note: it's at the end of a street and newer so Uber or grab is your best bet to make sure the drivers find it) 4. Rooms- tiny for the cheapest ones, but bed is comfy for just sleeping and winding down. Bathroom is good sized with hot water and basics. TV is available and a bit of storage. 5. Free breakfast - for what you pay, anything other than a room is a bonus now. But breakfast is good, several Filipino options and a few american (to those complaining it's limited- it's FREE breakfast at a budget hotel... If you want better food, venture outside for some restaurants or stay at Best Western for 5k a night and buffet) 6. Restaurant area- I didn't eat much at the resto and when I did it wasn't anything special. But the area was great for working. If you are on a business was trip, it is nice to have. 7. Parking- available first come,first served. If you need it, it's there. CONS: As people have said, on the back side rooms there is rampant rooster activity. This never bothered me as I was usually too tired when I got back to sleep. Be prepared, bring earplugs or noise cancelling. They can be very annoying. During my stay, the hallways were fairly quiet but it seems there is a potential to be loud in the peak seasons if more guests are in the hallway talking. Again, bring noise protection! Trust me, you'll need it even if you stay other places usually. Rooster and traffic noises are everywhere. If you temper your expectations, this hotel really is a great little gem. I'm glad I listened to the positive reviews and tried them out. I will be back here now every time I go to Cebu.

Our stay at Ocean Vida was fabulous. Upon arriving it was obvious that this was the best hotel on Bounty Beach/ Malapascua island.

The restaurant was some of the best food we had in the Philippines. They advised us of this but we were skeptical and tried elsewhere first only to be disappointed = EAT AT OCEAN VIDA! From the management to the bartenders and servers, it was clear that everyone enjoyed their job and felt they were a part of a family. Speaking with the owners, they are very committed to paying FAIR wages and running a top notch business while supporting the island's locals (something that is not common in the Philippines unfortunately). Literally only two complaints I can think of would be that the towels in the bathrooms weren't very nice and felt old (could be calcium in the water or something though, impacting how they feel after washing)and that there were a million families and their screaming children staying there at the same time as us. I was not expecting too much from this resort because of its description on their website. I was expecting it will be a place that will be good enough as a place to sleep.

Nothing else. But we were surprised to discover upon checking in that the place looks cozy. They have a nice pool. The family room with TV where our family stayed is quite big and with a nice interior complete with a mini-ref and coffee/tea making facility. The bathroom/toilet is also huge and nice. What made our stay more pleasant is the service. Everyone is accommodating. You can even order food that is not in their menu(as long as you order at least 3 hours in advance). They'll buy the ingredients from the market and cook for you at a very reasonable price. And before I forget, the sunrise view right in front of the resort's rooms is awesome!

Carolina , Philippines
Lapu-Lapu Cottages
7.4 Very good
Based on 73 reviews

I've spent one night here in order to be near the airport. Good value, calm and close to the airport (it took me about 20 minutes by car).

There's not much to do in the surroundings. The pool, the restaurant and staff were very nice. The room was clean but there's no safebox (you may leave your values at the reception). The bungalows (or some of them) are set by pairs. It's spacious between the bungalows. The garden is ok and the rabbits were funny to see. They are in good shape, although I think they were very hot like everybody else :). The room and the hotel need a refreshment and a new coat of painting! There was some stuff near the pool and it felt disorganized and a bit depressing. I had a little issue with Philippine Airlines. The staff was very helpful and let me use their phone. The WIFI connection was good enough for streaming videos from the restaurant. There was no connection from my room. This was not a problem for me. The hotel is easy to find. It's on Google Maps (but don't blindly trust the Google Maps GPS when it shows you an itinerary passing by many little streets). Just take the main road and stop by the Hotel Europa, in front of it there's a big sign for the hotel. When you check out I suggest you to walk to the main road if you want an Uber car to come. 2 different drivers couldn't find the hotel and cancelled their ride! I had to cancel the 3rd one and walk to the main road for a few minutes. It was ok, it's just that it's better to know this in advance. The little street that gets you to the hotel is humble and charming, far from the noisy main street. I met some neighbours and they were very friendly!

I stayed at Sascha's Lodge for one night to see the whale sharks in Oslob. The owners are very kind and accommodating, and the view is very nice.

For the area, it seems like a great choice. However, when it came time to shower for the night, I was very disappointed to learn that there was no hot water. When I asked the owner about it, she said that was her "next project" and told me I should have known that the lodge does not have hot water because it said so online. I double checked to see if I just overlooked that part of the description of the lodge, but nowhere do they disclose that the lodge simply does not have hot water. The only place I saw that was in a few customer reviews. The staff kindly brought a basin of boiled water to make up for it, which did the trick for the night. Mango lodge is the best place to stay here in Oslob! It is a short tricycle ride form the city centre in a nice little location.

As soon as we rocked up we knew the place was amazing, the staff were the best, very friendly and the rooms were the nicest we have stayed in for the first couple of weeks backpacking around Philippines, so nice we decided to extend and stay another longer, The rooms are so clean and nice another couple that checked in the next day wasted no time extending even longer after about a good 10 seconds of seeing the large spacious rooms. The staff are very accommodating when booking any activities you would like to do around the area, even if that's driving you to the see the whale sharks at 5.30 in the morning so your not waiting around from the big crowds, booking you tricycles or cooking you a very tasty breaky or lunch when you are hungry, this place is as good as it gets for backpackers or family's alike. They are building a family room out the side, by there new pool that we got transferd to out of there kindness as we mistakenly rocked up a day early to our second stay here after we returned to oslob from dumaguete and the room will be really nice for family's or groups when it's complete! Overall mango is the best place to stay highly suggest booking early as it's the place to be and is in high demand!

I enjoyed my stay at ResiDenz Guesthouse. I feel safe that it is inside a village. I like the extra space to park my car.

I like the fact that they respect my privacy and do not freely go inside the room for housekeeping (of course unless requested). One good positive point that was not mentioned here is the availability of hot/cold shower. I cannot live without it. Internet wifi signal is stronger at the common living room. Although, I would have wanted it to be stronger in my room on the 3rd level of the house too. It wasn't a problem for me, though, because ResiDenz Guesthouse is located at the heart of Mandaue where 3G signal is strong. Availability of cable TV is also a positive point for me especially because I am traveling alone. Ayala area is only 20 minutes away. If you need food, Parkmall is only 10 minutes away too. This is a great place to stay. I am definitely recommending this to my friends.

The location is easy to find since it is only along the road. We arrived 21:30 but they still accommodated us even their check in is 22:00 the latest.

They were also able to arrange us tour for whale watching for P500 including the transportation, and P700 transportation to Kawasan falls for canyoneering. We did both activities in a day since whale watching is only for 30mins and canyoneering lasts for 4 hours. But if you want to save money, you can take the bus from the lodge to whale watching by taking the bus and drop off near whale watching and pay the registration directly to the place. Schultz ,Canada

I did not find Cebu to be that great. But that may be from my lack of itinerary. Cebu has a few famous landmarks, such as "Magellan's Cross", Santo Nino Church and Fort San Pedro, but that wasn't enough to merit my stay there.

I do like history, but I was underwhelmed. I was impressed with the ease of finding taxis, but the traffic was pretty bad during weekdays. The taxis are very cheap, but sitting in a taxi for a long time makes me restless and I feel my vacation time withering away. The main problem was that I didn't do anything beach or swimming related. I would say for visitors, you need to arrange something like that to maximize what Cebu offers. Walking about the city seeing the above mentioned sights exposes you to the parts of Philippines that isn't pretty: the poverty. That goes for any city in Philippines. More about Cebu

Located on the east coast of Cebu, the most populous island of the Philippines, Cebu City is the oldest city in the country. Travelers here will receive a beautiful mix of the city’s historical and cosmopolitan character. Nicknamed the Queen City of the South, Cebu City attracts visitors to see its Spanish colonial churches, forts, and museums.

Travelers can enjoy access to this archipelago’s most authentic cultural experience from here. This regional capital boasts most of the facilities and hotels, and guests receive excellent service and amenities. From Cebu City, visitors can check out Mactan Island for upscale accommodation. This is an excellent location for those looking to do diving or bird watching. Another option would be a ferry ride to visit Malapascua Island. Beach resorts and more holiday diving experiences can be found in quiet Cordova.

With Cebu City’s business ports making this one of the country’s fastest growing cities, business travelers are regulars here. Cebu Business Park is the area to be with many classy and executive properties offering accommodation. The Ayala Center Cebu shopping mall is the highlight here and makes for the most ideal shopping destination.

Those traveling to Cebu City will use the Mactan-Cebu International Airport. Be sure to check out the interactive map of Cebu for information on hotel locations, attractions, and must-see destinations.

Travelers here will receive a beautiful mix of the city’s historical and cosmopolitan character. Nicknamed the Queen City of the South, Cebu City attracts visitors to see its Spanish colonial churches, forts, and museums. Travelers can enjoy access to this archipelago’s most authentic cultural experience from here. This regional capital boasts most of the facilities and hotels, and guests receive excellent service and amenities. From Cebu City, visitors can check out Mactan Island for upscale accommodation. This is an excellent location for those looking to do diving or bird watching. Another option would be a ferry ride to visit Malapascua Island. Beach resorts and more holiday diving experiences can be found in quiet Cordova. With Cebu City’s business ports making this one of the country’s fastest growing cities, business travelers are regulars here. Cebu Business Park is the area to be with many classy and executive properties offering accommodation. The Ayala Center Cebu shopping mall is the highlight here and makes for the most ideal shopping destination. Those traveling to Cebu City will use the Mactan-Cebu International Airport .
